html: (2 Nephi 27:25)."This people draw near me with their mouth." The essence of this phrase is hypocrisy: to profess one thing but to do another; to pretend to be something one is not, or to declare a belief in something that is not personally practiced. Some of the Lord's strongest rebukes have been directed at hypocrites whom He has labeled as "whited sepulchres" (whitewashed tombs), serpents, and vipers. (See Matthew 23:23-33.)
